page.title: 01MAIN LAND USE - HESKETH BANK
page.content: The D-Block area we had to survey was mainly concerned with reclaimed land from the River Asland and River Douglas and the adjacent marshes. Shore Road, which marked one of the boundaries, as it name indicates used to be at the edge of the sea and was often flooded until the great banks were built to reclaim the land. The land which has been reclaimed lies mainly to the north of Shore Road. The reclaimed land is mainly used for rough grazing for sheep, nearer the rivers, horses and then cattle. Nearer the main road the land is used for growing vegetables such as cauliflowers, cabbages, etc.. There are also a lot of glasshouses in the area which are used to cultivate the young vegatables and are also used mainly for growing tomatoes, lettuces and other salad vegetables.
